intro: Eriogonum contortum, commonly known as the twisted spireflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its wiry, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. Eriogonum contortum is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
